Situation in northern Syria:
Following negotiations between the U.S. and SDF, the SDF agreed to withdraw from most of the rest of their positions west of the Euphrates River in the Aleppo Governorate, including the towns of Dayr Hafir and Maskanah, leaving only their small bridgehead west of the Tishreen Dam. 
The first withdrawals from frontline positions near Dayr Hafir have already begun, with the main movements expected closer to 7am local time (around 5 hours from the time of writing). The STG has agreed not to target the withdrawing SDF units, who will receive reinforcements to assist in this operation. 
Meanwhile, clashes between the SDF and SNA + STG formations continue in the direction of the Tishreen dam (red square), while both sides continue mutual shelling of other areas with artillery and MLRS.

Russian forces have recaptured the village of Ivanivka, Dobropillya direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~54.
Total land area: ~0.38 km¬≤.

Ukrainian UAVs attacked the "Atlant Aero" plant in the city of Taganrog, Rostov Oblast.   Explosions were heard and a large fire broke out at the production buildings.   Atlant Aero specialises in the production of of aircraft and spacecraft. It also produces‚Ä¶

The Ukrainian Navy published high-resolution satellite imagery showing the damage the "Atlant Aero" plant sustained after it was hit by at least 1 Neptune cruise missile, and possibly UAVs, in Taganrog, Rostov Oblast.
The main damage is to production workshops for drones. This plant produces Molniya FPV drones, as components for Orion drones.

Last night, Russia carried out another Geran-2 drone attack on the Kyiv Hydroelectric Power Plant in the city of Vyshhorod, Kyiv Oblast.
At least 7 impacts were recorded, with power outages and fluctuations reported.

Kharkiv City is once again under attack from Russian Tornado-S rockets. 
At least 8 impacts have been recorded so far, targeting the Kharkiv Tractor Plant. A large fire can be seen burning from the impact site.

Kharkiv City is once again under attack from Russian Tornado-S rockets. 
At least 8 impacts have been recorded so far, targeting the Kharkiv Tractor Plant. A large fire can be seen burning from the impact site.

Update from northern Syria:
Following the SDF withdrawal from most of the Aleppo Governorate west of the Euphrates River, STG government forces began advancing further, collapsing SDF lines south of the river. 
- They advanced east down the M-4 highway, quickly reaching the city of Al Taqbah from the west. 
- They advanced north down the road from the M-42 Highway, capturing the Safiya and Thawra Oil Fields, before entering and establishing control over the Taqbah Airbase. 
- They advanced north up the M-6 Highway from Resafa, capturing Al-Mansurah, before pushing west down the M-4 Highway, reaching Al-Taqbah from the east, while other forces secured the rest of the southern bank of the Euphrates River further east.
From there, an assault on Al Taqbah was launched, with the STG capturing the southern part of the city, including the prison. Fierce street battles are ongoing with the SDF, who are expected to withdraw north over the Euphrates River soon. 
Meanwhile, fighting has begun in the Deir-Ezzor and Raqqah Governorates between tribal Arab groups and the SDF, resulting in the SDF bringing in reinforcements to those areas.

Footage showing Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the "Zaporizka" 750 kV substation and the "Zaporizhia-330" 330 kV substation in Zaporizhzhia Oblast. 
These strikes likely took place before January 13. Since then, the 750 kV substation has been hit with at least 6 Iskander-M ballistic missiles. A second fresh crater can also be seen in the snow behind the strike on the 330 kV substation.
750 kV coordinates: 47.99956, 35.50957
330 kV coordinates: 47.90490, 35.24912

Consequences of Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the 110 kV electrical substation in the city of Kiliya, Odesa Oblast. Approximately 10 drones were used.
The substation was protected by large concrete barriers aimed at minimising damage from Geran strikes, however these barriers suffered significant damage and a fire subsequently broke out. 
Coordinates: 45.47710, 29.24244

Consequences of Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the 110 kV electrical substation in the city of Kiliya, Odesa Oblast. Approximately 10 drones were used.
The substation was protected by large concrete barriers aimed at minimising damage from Geran strikes, however these barriers suffered significant damage and a fire subsequently broke out. 
Coordinates: 45.47710, 29.24244

In the Komyshuvakha direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations "wrapping up" the Ukrainian fortifications from the west, and have made new progress in two different areas. 
In the south, Russian forces continued taking positions northeast of Stepove, and entered new treelines and forest plantations in the direction of Mali Shcherbaky. 
To the north, the Russians secured positions northwest of Pavlivka, and following earlier infiltrations, consolidated in the western part of the village. Fierce fighting is ongoing for the rest of the settlement.
Additionally, Russian assault groups continued their attacks into Novoyakovlivka and Novoboikivske where the grey-zone remains.
+ ~4.24 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Omelnyk direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations and have advanced in two different areas.
In the southwest, after capturing Zelene, Russian forces advanced west and captured positions in the treelines east of the reservoirs. Other forces consolidated in the southern part of Olenokostiantynivka following earlier infiltrations, and pushed west from there too, capturing new positions in the treelines and an orchard and infiltrating further west in the direction of Tsitkove. 
In the northeast, Russian forces began advancing northwest of Solodke again. They managed to eliminate the Ukrainian presence in a number of areas, transforming the situation from a state of mixed positions overlapping each other, to somewhat solid Russian control. They also entered territory previously re-consolidated by Ukrainian forces, and recaptured a number of treeline positions there.
+ ~15.20 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Dobropillya direction, Russian forces have made additional progress in two different areas, while deep infiltrations into the grey-zone continue.
In the southwest, following earlier attacks, Russian forces managed to establish full control over Ivanivka. From there, they infiltrated further west in the direction of Novyi Donbas. Prior to this, infiltrations t Novyi Donbas were carried out along the railway line from Dorozhnje. Meanwhile, fighting continued in western and central Nove Shakhove, with both Russian and Ukrainian forces carrying out attacks.
To the northeast, Russian forces continued infiltrating deep into the grey-zone. The main Ukrainian resistance here consists of FPV drone strikes on movement  in Russian-controlled territory, and on the movements of soldiers through the grey-zone in the direction of Ukrainian positions. Russian forces continue carrying infiltrations into the dachas northeast of Nove Shakhove and towards the southern approaches to Kucheriv Yar.
To the east, Russian forces captured positions in the forest plantations just outside Toretske and entered the large trench fortification there. From there, Russian soldiers entered the southern part of the village and carried out infiltrations into its central streets.
+ ~2.01 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Kostyantynivka direction, Russian forces continued their offensive and have made new progress south of Kostyantynivka.
In the west, after clearing the pocket south of the highway, Russian forces began advancing north of the highway, capturing new treeline positions and entering the southeastern houses of Stepanivka.
To the east, Russian forces advanced northeast up the highway towards Berestok, capturing positions in the windbreaks. Other assault groups completed the capture of the forests north of the Kleban-Bykske Reservoir following a Ukrainian withdrawal and consolidated in additional treeline positions south of Berestok. A few Ukrainian soldiers remain trapped in bunkers in the forests north of the reservoir, and Russian forces are carrying out combing operations. Attacks are also being carried out north in the direction of Kostyantynivka, as well as through the fields in the grey-zone west of Ivanopillya.
In the northeast, Russian forces continued their assault operations in the area of the Kostyantynivka Railway Station and in the southeastern streets, but are struggling with logistics due to the Ukrainian FPV drone kill-zones imposed on logistical routes. Russian forces are also infiltrating in small groups along the highway from Stupochky, with some soldiers reaching as far as eastern Kostyantynivka. 
+ ~6.10 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Rai-Oleksandrivka direction, Russian forces continue to advance on a wide front from Sviato-Pokrovske to Markove, further developing their offensive. 
In the northeast, Russian forces fully secured the western face of the gulley that leads southwest from Riznykivka, capturing positions in the forest plantations there, and consolidated in the eastern part of the large forest to the southwest. They also captured additional positions on the tactical heights overlooking the forest.
To the southwest, following earlier infiltrations, Russian forces consolidated in the first houses of Nykyforivka. Attacks are continuing, aimed at expanding their foothold. 
Further southwest, the Russians captured the central and northeastern parts of Minkivka and improved their positions the southern and southwestern parts, while other forces secured new treeline positions to the south and advanced further northwest up the windbreaks on either side of the Siverskyi Donets Canal. Additionally, they captured further treeline positions southwest of Novomarkove and entered the eastern part of Markove which is now practically entirely in the grey-zone. 
+ ~8.63 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

Consequences of Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on an enterprise near Starokostyantyniv, Khmelnytskyi Oblast. 
Overnight, additional strikes were also carried out in the vicinity of Khmelnytskyi city, as well as on energy infrastructure in Vinnytsia Oblast.

Consequences of Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on an enterprise near Starokostyantyniv, Khmelnytskyi Oblast. 
Overnight, additional strikes were also carried out in the vicinity of Khmelnytskyi city, as well as on energy infrastructure in Vinnytsia Oblast.

 Here is the approximate situation in Syria this morning. Through the night the Syrian Army has established several bridgeheads over the Euphrates. While advances were modest in the region of Raqqa, the situation in Deir ez-Zor changed dramatically. 
The lightning advance of the Syrian Army and local uprising make it difficult to assess the reality on the ground. This map aims to stay conservative.
@wfwitness

 Bedouin tribes supported by the Damascus government forces are arriving at the outskirts of Raqqa city from the western side.
The Bedouin tribes and the Damascus government have also controled the Mashlab checkpoint east of Raqqa city.
The forces have started their initial entry into Raqqa city from the eastern side.
@wfwitness

Raqqa city witnessed clashes between SDF and tribal militants. 
@KurdishFrontNews

U.S. Issues Warning As Syrian Government Forces Corner Kurdish Fighters In Raqqa (Videos)
The United States military‚Äôs Central Command (CENTCOM) on January 17 issued a warning to the forces of the Islamist-led Syrian Transitional Government (STG) over their ongoing large-scale offensive against the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces in the north of the country.
The battle began in the morning when the STG sent its forces to a wide area to the west of the Euphrates River in the eastern Aleppo countryside. A day earlier the SDF announced its intention to withdraw from the area under an agreement meant to de-escalate tensions with Damascus. However, the deployment of the government began faster than what was agreed on.
The government didn‚Äôt stop there. It escalated further, designating all areas to the west of the Euphrates as a ‚Äúclosed military zone,‚Äù including the city of Tabqa and its surroundings in the southern Raqqa countryside, which were not a part of the original agreement.

Haichur Left Bank Under Fire: Russian Army Develops Offensive Against Ukrainian Forces In Zaporizhzhia
In the Zaporizhzhia sector, the Russian "East" units consolidated their success on the western bank of the Haichur River. They established control over Pryluky and advanced towards Vozdvyzhenka. The units also reached the approaches to Tsvitkove. 
In the Slaviansk sector, the Russian army made progress after consolidating its position in Zakotne. Units of the 3rd Army of the "South" grouping are advancing toward the Kryva Luka‚ÄìKalenyky line while continuing to fight intensely for Reznikivka. 
In the Kostiantynivka sector, fierce battles are ongoing to the northwest of the city. An offensive is also developing on the southern flank from the Kleban-Byk Reservoir. In the Sumy sector, assault groups advanced up to 750 meters along fifteen sections of the front in the Sumy region. 
Read more 
HERE

Syrian Government Takes Over Tabqa, SDF Collapses In Deir Ezzor After Tribal Uprising (Videos)
The forces of the Islamist-led Syrian Democratic Forces (STG) have captured the strategic city of Tabqa in the southern Raqqa countryside from the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF).
Syria‚Äôs Information Minister Hamza al-Mustafa announced the capture of the city along with the Euphrates Dam early on January 18. It was reported that several sleeper cells made of Arab tribal fighters linked to the STG facilitated the government‚Äôs final assault on the city.
The loss of Tabqa was a major blow to the SDF, whose leadership agreed to withdraw from a nearby area around the town of Deir Hafer in the western Aleppo countryside to de-escalate a day earlier. The STG took over that wide area, then pushed towards the city, effectively violating the agreement.
As STG forces were deploying in Tabqa, an Arab tribal uprising began in the areas controlled by the SDF in the eastern Deir Ezzor countryside.
Read more 
HERE

NATO's Greenland Theatrics And Arctic Expansionism
A perceived "fight" between NATO allies would shift attention and allow further militarization without officially focusing on Russia and China. Thus, there's certainly a possibility that the entire Greenland "fight" between the US and EU/NATO is nothing more than an elaborate (albeit crawling) scheme to improve the political West's strategic position in the ongoing race for the Arctic.
The Trump administration's threat to "take Greenland" (in effect, to invade Denmark, a fellow NATO member state) came as a total shock, especially to those who refuse to acknowledge that the strength of the political West is slowly degenerating into a mere shadow of its former self. Speaking of which, several EU/NATO armies proved that point, as well as the fact that they simply cannot survive without US assistance. And yet, on January 15, several European NATO member states sent their troops to Greenland, all in "support of Denmark".¬†Numerous media outlets reported¬†that a Danish US-made C-130 military transport aircraft landed overnight in Nuuk, Greenland's capital, carrying Danish and French soldiers.
